topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e84c37636872406e830000#post_53e84c37636872406e830000

Actually there's a lot of sand and surf, but people enjoy the sand for some reason, and yeah the country is one of the driest places on Earth. Though it could be said that we get our fair share of bad weather, we get cyclones and such which hit us as well. The good thing is we don't need to worry about having to deal with tsunamis and earthquakes, since we're on one of the most stable geological locations in the world.

Well the good thing is that we don't need to worry about bears and other animals which may or may not try and kill us when we sleep, but the sun is unbelievably hot even in the cities. Seriously we used to have 40+ temps along the coast during summer, some times for bloody days to weeks.

Its not as fun when you have no air con.

Finns are strange like that; +20 degrees outside is way too hot, and +60 degrees in a sauna is way too cold.
